Description: Ear-plug or bead: in one piece and of the flattened dumb-bell shape: a flat disc with, on its under-surface, a short shaft connecting with a smaller flat disc. The object, almost certainly moulded, is of opaque turquoise-blue glass with an opaque yellow thread around the circumference of each disc.
Curator's comments: This type of plug appears to be restricted to the late Eighteenth Dynasty, but cf. 1912,1109.262.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs Marion Whiteford Acworth JP
